## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

## Exercise 1 - Make a function

#' Group and Count
#'
#' Using this function, you will be able to group your data by a specified variable (x), and count the number of items contained in another variable (y)
#'
#' @params data The data that you will be using for this function
#' @params x The variable in which you will be grouping the data by
#' @params y The additional variable in which  be grouping the data by
```{r penguins}
group_and_count <- function(data, x, y) {
  data %>%
    group_by({{ x }}) %>%
    count({{ y }})
}

group_and_count(penguins, species, year)
```
#' Group & Summarize
#'
#' Using this function, you will be able to group your data by a specified variable (x), and create four columns indicating:
#' Max_Minus_Min
#' Mean
#' Stdev
#' IQR
#'
#' @params data The data that you will be using for this function
#' @params x The variable in which you will be grouping the data by
#' @params y The numerical variable where you


```{r penguins}
Data_overview <- function(data, x, y, na.rm = TRUE) {
  data %>%
  group_by({{ x }}) %>%
    if(!is.numeric({{ y }})) {
      stop('Oops! You must enter a numerical variable for your second variable, for this function to work')
      }
  summarise(Max_Minus_Min = (max({{ y }}) - min({{ y }})),
            Mean = mean({{ y }}),
            Stdev = sd({{ y }}),
            IQR = IQR({{ y }}))
}

Data_overview(penguins, species, island)
```
